title: Profile Permissions
content:
Starting with Firefox 141, I noticed the profile folder is locked down by Mozilla by way of folder permissions, to the extent that I (as administrator) cannot even take ownership of the folder. Even after I completely uninstalled Firefox and restarted my computer I can't take ownership of the folder, nor can I delete it - access is simply denied. I have to literally boot up with a Linux Live distro to be able to delete it. This is invasive and NOT OK!!

I work with multiple profiles that require backups and be copied. I also have a 'master profile' which is set up to co contain all my settings and addons - when I require a new profile I simply copy it over and voila. Not even this is possible anymore, as Mozilla has locked down the entire folder tree, I can no longer copy a new profile into C:\Users\*USER*\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles.

I also cannot copy existing profiles (and therefore also not able to backup) out of C:\Users\*USER*\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles - access denied. This is uncalled for by Mozilla. I have complete removed Firefox from my computer, including registry entries, and even after that I'm still denied access and cannot even delete C:\Users\*USER*\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla.

The only solution to to any of the above issues is to either reboot into Windows Safe Mode or bootable media of another OS. But this is totally impractical - Mozilla cannot expect of me to stop all my work and restart my PC every time I need to perform any of the above mentioned issues.

This is highly invasive by Mozzilla - to not even be able to delete a profile folder without any trace of Mozilla on my computer???? Come on, FIX THIS !!!

Will Mozilla please provide the solution?
creator: xpk

title: My bookmarks are all gone after power cycling my computer
content:
I power cycled my computer in order to install some Windows updates, and when I opened up Firefox again, I had precisely zero bookmarks.

I found this folder, which is supposed to contain my automatic backups: https://i.postimg.cc/bwrWBswd/A.png

But I can't figure out how to use those files to restore my bookmarks.

When I click on Manage Bookmarks > Import and Backup > Restore > Choose File, nothing happens. No other option seems viable.

I had an ASSLOAD of bookmarks on this browser, so I need to recover them because there's just no way I'll be able to remember them all manually and add them all back one at a time!

What do I do?

title: Autofill Lookup Field on Microsoft Marketing Form in Firefox does not work correctly
content:
Hello,

we use Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing Forms and found out that there is an issue regarding lookup fields in Firefox.

When we use autofill and, for example, the lookup field “Country” is filled with the value “SE” because the country stored in Firefox is Sweden, the value remains in the field even though it does not match the values in the field. This is not the case with Edge and Chrome. I have already contacted Microsoft Support, and they said that this is a Firefox-specific problem and not a Dynamics 365 Marketing problem.

How can this problem be fixed?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards

Michael

title: RHS Vertical Scrolling not working in LastPass on Firefox
content:
I use Firefox as my default browser on two computers running Windows 11 & Linux operating systems.

From a few days ago I can no longer scroll down the entries in LastPass using the mouse on my HP Laptop (Windows 11). I thought it might be a LastPass issue so I tried opening LastPass in the Microsoft Edge browser and the RHS up\down scrolling is working just fine.

Is there some setting in Firefox (or between Firefox and LastPass) which is suddenly preventing me from scrolling up and down the entries). I can still scroll down by using the touch screen, but not using the mouse.

The other thing that drives me crazy is that I cannot permanently change all of the enties in LastPass into a simple list, rather than boxes. Is this anything to do with Firefox or is this a LastPass issue.

Regards jungle - A long time Firefox User

title: language translate and storage
content: There is some worst problem with Firefox for android's management of storage data. When I click on translate a page, it download some pack of the source/target languages and keeps it in app's data permanently. The language also does not show as been downloaded in the translate setting section. Unwantedly firefox consumes persistent storage only for just after we randomly to translate a page from a random language and firefox android download unwanted languge's pack and event does not show in downloaded languages. No way to clean the storage apark from "clear data" which we do not want to do ! Same happens when you have an incognito session with multiple tabs open, and the system closes Firefox when you open some other apps. Firefox loses track of the "potentially to be deleted" data. Firefox data increased forever after such a Hard closed session.(in low RAM device 3-4GB). No other option except to Clear Firefox's data!

content:

 The only password and username that i entered into my LinuxLaptop  are the only usernames and passwords

that I've entered into my new computer. I've also entered my google Chrome username and password to set up my Thunderbird email service. I never wanted to sync all my usernames and passwords in my Acer laptop computer because I felt that that made it too simple for a hacker to access all of my personal Information and access to accounts. I just want to successfully transfer all of my Favorates folders and files then all my Documents and picture files to my new computer. I'm a Photography artist, Graphic Designer,abstract painter, and creative writer. I can't move forward in my creative pursuits without completing these tasks. Thanks very much for your help and information. I'm soon to be 80 years old and not a very good keypuncher on a computer.
